meanings.definition: Remove from office or position of authority, especially from the priesthood.
meanings.sent1: The bishop was defrocked for his misconduct.
meanings.sent2: The church defrocked the priest for breaking the rules.
meanings.sent3: The defrocked priest decided to open a bakery instead.
meanings.sent4: Being defrocked felt like losing a part of his identity.
meanings.sent5: The news of the defrocked clergyman spread quickly through the town.

meanings.definition: Strip of the right to wear the symbols of a particular profession or rank.
meanings.sent1: The soldier was defrocked of his medals for disobedience.
meanings.sent2: The chef was defrocked of his apron for his poor performance.
meanings.sent3: The defrocked pilot started a new career as a painter.
meanings.sent4: Losing his uniform felt like being defrocked from his identity.
meanings.sent5: The defrocked officer felt naked without his badge.
